    tags: [RootEffect, ReadEnvEffect, ReadDirEffect, ReadIOEffect], forbids: [].}
A sugar to combine await splitLines sh.runGetOutput(...) in a single call
  • Can raise ExecError if not successful
  • OutputErr stream is not included (removed in release mode, but captured in debug mode -> only show on error)
proc runGetLines(sh: ProcArgs; cmd: seq[string]; prefixCmd = none(seq[string]);
                 toAdd: set[ProcOption] = {}; toRemove: set[ProcOption] = {};
                 input = none(AsyncIoBase); output = none(AsyncIoBase);
                 outputErr = none(AsyncIoBase); env = none(ProcEnv);
                 envModifier = none(ProcEnv); workingDir = none(string);
                 processName = none(string); logFn = none(LogFn);
                 onErrorFn = none(OnErrorFn); cancelFut: Future[void] = nil): Future[
    seq[string]] {....raises: [Exception, ValueError], tags: [RootEffect,
    ReadEnvEffect, ReadDirEffect, ReadIOEffect], forbids: [].}
proc runGetOutput(sh: ProcArgs; cmd: seq[string];
                  argsModifier: ProcArgsModifier; cancelFut: Future[void] = nil): Future[
    string] {....stackTrace: false, raises: [Exception, ValueError],
              tags: [RootEffect, ReadEnvEffect, ReadDirEffect, ReadIOEffect],
              forbids: [].}
A sugar to combine withoutLineEnd await sh.runAssert(...).output in a single call
  • Can raise ExecError if not successful
  • LineEnd is always stripped, because it is usually unawanted. Use sh.run if this comportement is not wanted
  • OutputErr stream is not included (removed in release mode, but captured in debug mode -> only show on error)
proc runGetOutput(sh: ProcArgs; cmd: seq[string]; prefixCmd = none(seq[string]);
                  toAdd: set[ProcOption] = {}; toRemove: set[ProcOption] = {};
                  input = none(AsyncIoBase); output = none(AsyncIoBase);
                  outputErr = none(AsyncIoBase); env = none(ProcEnv);
                  envModifier = none(ProcEnv); workingDir = none(string);
                  processName = none(string); logFn = none(LogFn);
                  onErrorFn = none(OnErrorFn); cancelFut: Future[void] = nil): Future[
    string] {....raises: [Exception, ValueError],
              tags: [RootEffect, ReadEnvEffect, ReadDirEffect, ReadIOEffect],
              forbids: [].}
proc runGetOutputStream(sh: ProcArgs; cmd: seq[string];
                        argsModifier: ProcArgsModifier;
                        cancelFut: Future[void] = nil): (AsyncIoBase,
    Future[void]) {....raises: [OSError, Exception], tags: [RootEffect,
    ReadEnvEffect, ReadDirEffect, ReadIOEffect], forbids: [].}
A sugar doing this: await splitLines sh.run(..., output = stream) in a single call
  • Can raise ExecError if not successful
  • Second return value is a future that will be finished when the subprocess has been waited
  • OutputErr stream is not included (removed in release mode, but captured in debug mode -> only show on error)
proc runGetOutputStream(sh: ProcArgs; cmd: seq[string];
                        prefixCmd = none(seq[string]);
                        toAdd: set[ProcOption] = {};
                        toRemove: set[ProcOption] = {};
                        input = none(AsyncIoBase); output = none(AsyncIoBase);
                        outputErr = none(AsyncIoBase); env = none(ProcEnv);
                        envModifier = none(ProcEnv); workingDir = none(string);
                        processName = none(string); logFn = none(LogFn);
                        onErrorFn = none(OnErrorFn);
                        cancelFut: Future[void] = nil): (AsyncIoBase,
    Future[void]) {....raises: [OSError, Exception], tags: [RootEffect,
    ReadEnvEffect, ReadDirEffect, ReadIOEffect], forbids: [].}
proc runGetStreams(sh: ProcArgs; cmd: seq[string];
                   argsModifier: ProcArgsModifier; cancelFut: Future[void] = nil): (
    AsyncIoBase, AsyncIoBase, Future[void]) {....raises: [OSError, Exception],
    tags: [RootEffect, ReadEnvEffect, ReadDirEffect, ReadIOEffect], forbids: [].}
  • Similar to runGetOutputStream, but returns both output stream and outputErr stream
  • OutputErr stream is not included (removed in release mode, but captured in debug mode -> only show on error)
proc runGetStreams(sh: ProcArgs; cmd: seq[string];
                   prefixCmd = none(seq[string]); toAdd: set[ProcOption] = {};
                   toRemove: set[ProcOption] = {}; input = none(AsyncIoBase);
                   output = none(AsyncIoBase); outputErr = none(AsyncIoBase);
                   env = none(ProcEnv); envModifier = none(ProcEnv);
                   workingDir = none(string); processName = none(string);
                   logFn = none(LogFn); onErrorFn = none(OnErrorFn);
                   cancelFut: Future[void] = nil): (AsyncIoBase, AsyncIoBase,
    Future[void]) {....raises: [OSError, Exception], tags: [RootEffect,
    ReadEnvEffect, ReadDirEffect, ReadIOEffect], forbids: [].}
proc running(p: AsyncProc): bool {....raises: [Exception], tags: [RootEffect],
                                   forbids: [].}
proc start(sh: ProcArgs; cmd: seq[string]; argsModifier: ProcArgsModifier): AsyncProc {.
    ...raises: [OSError, Exception],
    tags: [ReadEnvEffect, RootEffect, ReadDirEffect, ReadIOEffect], forbids: [].}
It is the responsability of the caller to close its end of AsyncStream, AsyncPipe, etc. to avoid deadlocks Some commands will only work well if stdin is connected to a pseudo terminal: if parent is inside a terminal, then don't use CaptureInput, and use either Interactive with stdin = nil or stdin = stdinAsync 
proc start(sh: ProcArgs; cmd: seq[string]; prefixCmd = none(seq[string]);
           toAdd: set[ProcOption] = {}; toRemove: set[ProcOption] = {};
           input = none(AsyncIoBase); output = none(AsyncIoBase);
           outputErr = none(AsyncIoBase); env = none(ProcEnv);
           envModifier = none(ProcEnv); workingDir = none(string);
           processName = none(string); logFn = none(LogFn);
           onErrorFn = none(OnErrorFn)): AsyncProc {.
    ...raises: [OSError, Exception],
    tags: [ReadEnvEffect, RootEffect, ReadDirEffect, ReadIOEffect], forbids: [].}
proc suspend(p: AsyncProc) {....raises: [OSError], tags: [], forbids: [].}
proc terminate(p: AsyncProc) {....raises: [OSError], tags: [], forbids: [].}
wait() should be called after terminate to clean up resource 
proc wait(self: AsyncProc; cancelFut: Future[void] = nil): Future[ProcResult] {.
    ...stackTrace: false, raises: [Exception, ValueError], tags: [RootEffect],
    forbids: [].}
Permits to wait for the subprocess to finish in a async way Mandatory to clean up its resource (opened files, memory, etc.) (apart if the process is intended to be a daemon) Will not close or kill the subprocess, so it can be a deadlock if subprocess is waiting for input (solution is to close it) However this function doesn't need to be called to flush process output (automatically done to avoid pipie size limit deadlock) Raise OsError if cancelFut is triggered

Made with Nim. Generated: 2024-05-02 18:25:50 UTC
